snippet: Tom Wheeler, the F.C.C. chairman, will seek to invalidate state laws that limit community-owned Internet providers from expanding. The proposal focuses on North Carolina and Tennessee, but could affect many other states.
abstract: Tom Wheeler, the F.C.C. chairman, will seek to invalidate state laws that limit community-owned Internet providers from expanding. The proposal focuses on North Carolina and Tennessee, but could affect many other states.

headline.main: F.C.C. Chief Wants to Override State Laws Curbing Community Net Services
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Chief Wants to Remove Limits on Municipal Internet
